nodes.text: The Rodian spy Pall Gopal procured a package for the Resistance that contained materials necessary for their base in the Black Spire Ruins on the Outer Rim planet Batuu. Around 34 ABY, he hired the smuggler Izal Garsea to deliver it to the Ithorian proprietor Dok-Ondar in Batuu's Black Spire Outpost.

By the time Gopal bequeathed the package to Garsea, the silver metal on its outside had scuff marks, and it had a keypad locking its contents inside. While carrying the package around Batuu, Garsea kept the mid-sized rectangular briefcase in a backpack. During her day on Batuu, she accidentally misplaced Gopal's package, having swapped it with the one her friend Julen Rakab had been carrying. Working together, the pair recovered the package, which had been delivered to the headquarters of Ohnaka Transport Solutions, a local shipping operation. After meeting with Dok-Ondar, Garsea later delivered the package to two Resistance members, one of which was Lejo.
Pall Gopal's package first appeared in A Crash of Fate, a canon 2019 young-adult novel written by Zoraida Córdova.
